data.text: @CDesign @carouzzz @Dark_Falcon7 @Caerage @AE1TT @IncognitoNewt @AinsTx @diakopter @MBTrumpwatcher @kes1doc_karen I think the only way is for them to be in someone else's name. So, "selling" your house to someone you absolutely trust so it's not in your name, etc. You prob need to talk to a financial planner.

@carouzzz @DisChimera @Dark_Falcon7 @Caerage @AE1TT @IncognitoNewt @AinsTx @diakopter @MBTrumpwatcher @kes1doc_karen I feel for you. I was paying 3.6k a month at one point for meds not covered out of pocket besides paying ins arrive copays, deductibles... If you're a rare bird the issues with medical care are defeating at times.

@carouzzz @DisChimera @Dark_Falcon7 @Caerage @AE1TT @IncognitoNewt @AinsTx @diakopter @MBTrumpwatcher @kes1doc_karen A bit off topic but I am trying to find a way to keep my assets protected (house eq) have you heard of a medicare protect trust? I will be in the same boat as you soon and trying to figure out the landscape. I'm sorry. It a shame.

@carouzzz @Dark_Falcon7 @Caerage @AE1TT @IncognitoNewt @AinsTx @diakopter @CDesign @MBTrumpwatcher @kes1doc_karen Jeez. Like you could sell your house to pay for your meds? Or get a 2nd mortgage? Then a 3rd? Def crazy! I'm so, so sorry.

@carouzzz @Dark_Falcon7 @Caerage @AE1TT @IncognitoNewt @AinsTx @diakopter @CDesign @MBTrumpwatcher @kes1doc_karen So, one makes 125,000. Has to pay 84K for the med. Net annual income -- to live on -- is 41K. Are you poor enough now? 🙄
